oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roy Acuff Grand Ole Opry Discs: Tape 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Roy Acuff's Royal Crown sponsored Grand Ole Opry. The tape is labeled Acuff's tape number three of an unidentified number. The tape features multiple recordings. The additional recordings are sponsored by American Ace Coffee. The recording features Grant Turner (host) and Louie Buck (host) and features performances by: Bradley Kincaid (musician), Curly Fox (musician), Roy Acuff (musician/host), Jimmie Riddle (musician), Pap Wilson (musician), Tommy Jackson (musician), Flatt and Scruggs (musicial duo), Bill Monroe (musician), the Smokey Mountain Belles (musicial group), and the Oak Ridge Quartet (musicial duo). The tape is from a multitude of dates from: November 22, 1947; and November 29, 1947.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bradley Kincaid; Curly Fox; Roy Acuff; Jimmie Riddle; Pap Wilson; Tommy Jackson; Louie Buck; Flatt and Scruggs; Bill Monroe; Smokey Mountain Belles; Oak Ridge Quartet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) The Girl I Love Don't Pay Me No Mind [incomplete] (Oswald) -- (00:25) Hummingbird Special [skips] (Bradley Kincaid) -- (02:36) Breakdown [skips] (Curly Fox) -- (05:01) Lonesome Valley [skips] (Roy Acuff) -- (07:23) Grant Turner performs a Royal Cola commercial [incomplete] -- (07:57) Raggin' the Rails [skips] (Jimmie Riddle and Pap Wilson) -- (09:45) Money Musk (Tommy Jackson) -- (11:05) Royal Crown Closing Theme [featuring Louie Buck outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (12:00) Everyone Knew it But Me (Flatt and Scruggs) -- (14:09) Orange Blossom Special (Bill Monroe) -- (15:28) Opening Theme [featuring Grant Turner voiceover] (Roy Acuff) -- (16:29) Golden Treasure (Roy Acuff) -- (19:16) Sally Goodin (Tommy Jackson) -- (21:06) American Ace Opening Theme [featuring Grant Turner introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (22:05) Tennessee Central #9 (Roy Acuff) -- (24:38) Sweethearts or Strangers (Smokey Mountain Belles) -- (26:21) Roy Acuff and Grant Turner perform an American Ace commercial spot -- (27:42) Rocky Mountain Express (Jimmie Riddle) -- (28:45) I'm Sorry, It's Too Late for Tears (Oak Ridge Quartet) -- (30:32) I'll Fly Away (Oak Ridge Quartet) -- (31:58) I'll be Satisfied (Oak Ridge Quartet)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Kincaid, Bradley; Fox, Curly; Fox, Curly, 1910-1995; Acuff, Roy; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Pap Wilson; Jackson, Tommy; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Flatt and Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys (Musical group); Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Smoky Mountain Belles; Oak Ridge Quartet;
